get.summary: Get a collection of IRI resources.
get.description: Returns a list of IRI resources matching the query.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Provides media types that are acceptable for the response. At the moment application/json is the supported response encoding.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: The HTTP request may contain the If-Modified-Since header requesting all models with creationTime after the specified date. The date must be specified in RFC 1123 format.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The group parameter will filter resources based on group membership.  If group is specified then only resources that are a member of the specified group will be returned.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Return only resources of this type.

parameters.name: capability
parameters.description: Return only resources with this capability.

parameters.name: current_status
parameters.description: Return only resources with these status values.

get.summary: Get a list of available incident resources.
get.description: Returns a list of incident resources matching the specified query

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Provides media types that are acceptable for the response. At the moment application/json is the supported response encoding.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: The HTTP request may contain the If-Modified-Since header requesting all models with creationTime after the specified date. The date must be specified in RFC 1123 format.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of a resource.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of incident.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The type of resolution to the incident.

schema.description: The current state of the incident resolution.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Search for incidents overlapping with time, where start <= time <= end.  The time query parameter must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone offsets.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Search for incidents/events that are active after (and including) the specified from time.  The from query parameter must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone offsets.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Search for incidents/events that are active before (and including) the specified 'to' time.  The from query parameter must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone offsets.

parameters.name: short_name
parameters.description: The short name of the resource.

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: A list of resources to match.

200.description: OK - Returns a list of available IRI resources matching the request criteria.

ProjectAllocation.description: Defines a project's allocation for a capability (aka. repo).  This allocation is a piece of the total allocation for the capability (eg. 5% of the total node hours of Perlmutter GPU nodes).  A project would at least have a storage and job repos, maybe more than 1 of each.

Capability.description: Defines an aspect of a resource that can have an allocation. For example,  Perlmutter nodes with GPUs. For some resources at a facility, this will be 1 to 1 with the resource.  It is a way to further subdivide a resource into allocatable sub-resources.  The word  "capability" is also known to users as something they need for a job to run (eg. gpu).
